fields.description:
- Work mode only 
- Confirmation dialog 
- Notification that it was successfully removed (with a link to the issue on Plan mode)
fields.summary: Add a detail view cog menu item to remove an issue from a Sprint (DOES cause scope change)
Remove Scrum labs flag and enable for all

fields.description:
This is just an idea - and may not be feasible for the GreenHopper wider audience...
I like the new version that displays the sub-tasks underneath the story on the RapidBoard.
A nice extension of this would be to be able to see all linked issues (as well as remotely-linked) issues to the story.
fields.summary: As a RapidBoard user, I would like to see the linked and remote-linked issues to a story

fields.description: In GH you can see the burn down chart only persprint, not for the full project. For a customer it can be interesting to see the overview of the whole project in a burn down chart.
fields.summary: Add overall project burn down chart

fields.description: To quickly see how many points were burned already it would be good to have this information added to the stats summary located on the right hand side of the graph in the GH burn-down chart
fields.summary: Add information about points burned to the side panel

fields.description: Analytics have been added to the product, but the EAC page has not been updated. Rosie watches this page to ensure that the public documentation is up to date.
fields.summary: Update analytics page on EAC with currently tracked information

fields.description:
Please add the following to help-paths.properties:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking
fields.summary: link to CAC page (via help-paths.properties) from the 'Estimation' tab in Board Config

fields.description: Right now, it lets me type version name and description, only to tell me on submit that I don't have the necessary permissions. This should already be in the dialog so I avoid typing stuff which gets lost.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the "release" feature on the work mode to tell me if I don't have necessary permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4956].
  {panel}

At the moment ranking behaviour with filters on is confusing. Given a backlog of: 

  TST-1, TST-2, TST-3, <Marker>, TST-4, TST-5 

Use Instant Filter to filter the backlog to: 

  <Marker>, TST-5 

Drag TST-5 above the marker (to get TST-5, <Marker>) then remove the filter, you will get: 

   TST-1, TST-2, TST-3, TST-5, TST-4 

(i.e TST-4 has somehow also been dragged over the marker). It appears that all issues up to the filtered issue also end up above the marker rather than the action counting as a re-rank of just the selected issue to be immediately below the issue that is lowest ranked above the marker.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have intuitive ranking behaviour while filters are active

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

At http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Rapid+Board the documentation indicates: 

"Estimate Stories — You can use the 'J' and 'K' keys to move through issues in the backlog and get details on the right-hand side of the screen. Plug in your estimates or story points as you go. (Note that you can only add story points for issues of type 'Story'.)" 

This isn't quite accurate. You can specify story points for any Issue Type that has the field applied. By default this is Epics and Stories but this can be changed from the Custom Field configuration. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Story Points can be set on any issue type that has the field applied, not just Stories

fields.description:
1. Load a control chart in the report section of a rapid board
2. Set the time frame to something other than "All Time"
3. Double click anywhere in the control chart.
4. Notice that the time frame changes to "All Time"

I found this when I was trying to view an issue from the control chart. I personally do not think it should change the timeframe shown just by double clicking.

Affects 5.9.4
fields.summary: Double clicking the control chart changes the time shown to "All Time"

fields.description:
.       Click “Manage Rapid Board” from Agile tab
2.       Select the Rapid Board Actions icon
3.       Select Create Board
4.       Select Advanced tab
5.       Type filter into Projects/Saved Filter
6.       Since it does not auto populate the filter I click on the Rapid Board Name 
7.       Add name
8.       Select Create

!screenshot-1.jpg!
fields.summary: rapid board filter does not autocomplete or allow the selection of filters that do not start with a symbol, number, or the letter "A"

fields.description:
We run a bunch of reports for the current milestone.  However using the new rapid board, we can't retrieve the issues in a sprint without knowing the id of the sprint.

It would be nice to be able to jql search for the name of the sprint instead.

As a workaround is it possible via rest to look up the sprint id when all i know is the name?
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues based on sprint name

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

Could you please check my updates to: 

 https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+a+Rapid+Board#ConfiguringaRapidBoard-AddingaSub-FilterforWorkmode

Also, for some reason it does not look like this feature was captured in the release notes (GHS-3929). Would we normally go back and change this?
fields.summary: Sub-Filter in work mode
Inconsistent j/k behaviour with swimlanes that don't have children in a given column
Fake parent tooltip does not update when changing the parent summary
IE8:L Weird artefact on right side edge of swimlane
Discuss interactions between the sprint tracking and backlog item estimates in the UI

fields.description:
- Show the statistic in detail, editable in plan mode only 
- If a Sprint is started warn if there is no estimate for an item that has the sprint tracking statistic
fields.summary: Allow a numeric field to be specified Sprint tracking statistic for the Rapid Board

fields.description:
- Cover how to apply statistics to different issue types
- Once complete please re-raise a story to the backlog to include a link from the warning dialog (refer to issue GHS-4920)
fields.summary: Create a document that describes the importance of the Backlog item estimation statistic

fields.description:
- Warn offers OK or Cancel
- "The following issues do not have a <estimate unit> estimate specified. Estimates applied following the start of the Sprint will be considered scope change"
- Happens before the Sprint name and dates dialog
fields.summary: Warn on start sprint if primary items do not have the backlog item estimate set

fields.description: Allow the Backlog item estimation statistic for a Rapid Board to be selected to be set to Original Estimate
fields.summary: Allow the Backlog item estimation statistic for a Rapid Board to be set to Original Estimate

fields.description:
Allow a Business Value tracking field to be selected, the default should be the Business Value field but it should be possible to set it to any other numeric field 
Allow the detail view to show the Business Value tracking field and for it to be inline edited 
Provide a Business Value delivered chart that is identical to the Velocity chart but plots the business value estimate
fields.summary: Create Business Value Delivered chart

fields.description: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Estimation+and+Tracking+in+the+Rapid+Board#EstimationandTrackingintheRapidBoard-Proposal
fields.summary: Allow Column Constraint to be set to any numeric field (i.e Story Points)

fields.description:
- The Velocity chart will show amount of the Backlog item estimation statistic from Sprint to Sprint 
- The graph is bucketed by Sprint 
- For each Sprint the velocity is equal to the sum of the backlog item estimate for all issues that are in the last column at the end of the Sprint
- Would also show the sum of estimation statistic committed to during the Sprint (i.e the ones that did not get done)
- The PBI estimate used is from the time the issue was added to the Sprint (i.e at the start of the Sprint if the item was in at Sprint start or at the time it was added in the middle of the Sprint)
- The graph is followed by a table that describes the values shown in the table
- For each Sprint a row is shown along with the sum of completed and non completed PBIs, hyperlink to the Sprint report
- A link is provided to the detailed Sprint burndown for that Sprint 
- For now hardcode to last 7
fields.summary: Implement the Velocity chart

fields.description:
- Allow the Backlog item estimation statistic for a *Scrum* Rapid Board to be selected, the default should be the Story Point field but it should also be possible to set  any other Numeric field 
- Show the Backlog item estimation statistic on the Plan mode in the lozenge
- Replaces existing use of lozenge (in detail view & card view)
- Label unit as 'Estimate', on hover show unit
fields.summary: Allow the backlog item estimation statistic to be selected as any numeric field in the issue

fields.description:
- Add a new 'Subtasks' tab with an add button 
- For each sub task: Show summary, key, avatar, status, remaining estimate, edit button (JIRA Edit Dialog), delete button
fields.summary: Add a subtasks tab to the detail view on plan mode

fields.description:
- Changes in the remaining estimate are burned down as they happen 
- Time spent burns up 
- Items that are added to the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change 
- Items that are removed from the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change
fields.summary: Make the Sprint Burndown chart use remaining estimate when the board has been configured that way

fields.description: - For the specified estimation statistic field (assuming the 'time tracking' option has not been specified for tracking)
fields.summary: Implement Sprint Burndown chart (for Numeric Fields)

fields.description:
- Include scheduled start/end and actual end (triggered when hit complete button)
- Divide into issues completed during Sprint and those not, include the status of the item at the end of the Sprint 
- Include the estimate statistic for each item (ideally from time the item was added to the Sprint but current if not easy) - include the sum of the statistic (i.e the velocity)
- -Call out issues that were added and removed-
fields.summary: Enhance Sprint Report

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:
# Go to Rapid Board (Work)
# Select multiple issue using 
# Try to transition that issue to another column

Expected behavior:
Since we are allowed to select multiple ticket at once in Rapid Board (Work), we should be able to transition these issue at once.

This bug is generated from SAC:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-122856
fields.summary: Unable to move multiple tickets at a time between Rapid Board (Work) columns

fields.description:
Hello team,
As per [JSP-123047|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-123047]

{quote}
I've defined several sprints (versions) through Greenhopper. After completing a sprint, I "released" it. Now, when I'm on the Chart Board, it's not listed until my list of versions, and, therefore, cannot look at my charts/statistics for that sprint. Is there another way to looked at this historical data?
{quote}

The customer basically wants to have access to the already released data, like it was before the release date. 
Could you please consider this as an improvement to add this functionality?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Display statistic data on Released Board
As a user, I'd like to avoid confusion when hitting enter in the description field and having that save by saving on blur

fields.description:
NB. note "Only available if you are using GH"

NB. mention on "Plan mode" page and "Work mode" page and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Sprint

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

We've experienced some delays and we now do not intend to release most of the functionality from the current Sprint in 5.9.4 (but rather in 5.9.5). The only significant feature we will release is the ability to set GreenHopper as your MyJiraHome (only if the Scrum labs is enabled).
fields.summary: 5.9.4 will be very slimmed down

fields.description:
In work mode:
- If no issues present and logged out, indicate they might like to log in (with a link) 
- If no issues present and logged in, offer a link to plan mode where that might be performed 

In plan mode: 
- If no issues present and logged out show a notification indicating you may like to log in (with a link) to see issues and plan a Sprint

If report mode: 
- If no issues present and logged out show a notification indicating you may like to log in (with a link)

*The link should automatically redirect back to the page after log in*
fields.summary: Improve Rapid Board experience when no issues are available
Large Custom icons are not sized in the create subtask issuetype dropdown

fields.description: The problem compounds the more columns are added. Obviously the test data here is unrealistic, but with 6 columns the max chars before overflow is 23
fields.summary: Column titles in board configuration overflow disasterously

fields.description: AMPS 3.7+ adds the {{Atlassian-Build-Date}} entry to your plugin manifest, and this is used to enforce plugin maintenance expiry. However, GH is currently building with AMPS 3.6. See GHS-4887 for why this is a problem.
fields.summary: Bump maven-jira-plugin version to 3.9.1

fields.description:
There should be possibility to ignore time part of Date started field for "Log work" feature because it's very natural way to log every day work.

When I log work for some day I must not bother of my timezone or server timezone or my colleagues timezone because it doesn't make any sense for me as I log work for each day. It is important cause it influences the Burndown chart which is always in server timezone. 

Related issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4872 
Instead of introducing timezone selecting for Burndown chart (though it's better than nothing) I would strongly insist to just eliminate timezone for such charts and "Log work" feature because the March 29 is the same day for Japan, Europe or USA. And if someone worked for March 29 that means that everyone in the world should see that he/she worked for March 29. But now some people see work for March 28, some for March 29 and some for March 30 which is total absurd.

At least there should be an option to include feature such as "Ignore timezones when logging work". And therefore all charts should take into account such an option.

I guess this issue could affect both Jira and Greenhopper
fields.summary: The "Log work" Date started field should count only Date part, not the Time part

fields.description:
* Usage of {{attr()}} method on things which are not attributes
* Lucene date format
* JIRA.RestfulTable
* jQuery handling of live events when things are "clicked" that aren't in the DOM
* anything else that comes up
fields.summary: Get GreenHopper 5.1 compatible

fields.description:
hello together,

we have a version in greenhopper with some sprints.
 * 1.0
  ** Sprint 1
  ** Sprint 2
  ** Sprint 3
  ** Backlog

Now it would be good to get a overview on how many story points the version 1.0 has assigned. Based on that the chart should give us the required story point burndown for each sprint. If a sprint is released the chart should show the how many story points we got in that sprint. I was not able to find that information within the release or chart board within GreenHopper. But this is a essential view for a Scrum project.

Enclosed I have a example for you, see "example.png".

The only way I found with GreenHopper is the Statistic Burndown Chart with the Story Point field. But this uses days as perspective and not the sprints. therefore you are not able to see any relevant informations on it, see "charts.png".

Regards,
Dirk

=> The screenshots can be found in: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4237 - I do not want to make them public.
fields.summary: Charting functions for GreenHopper based on project planning with Story Points are unusable
Possibility to get a view that shows all issues that are 'In Progress' but has no CHANGED 'Remaining Estimate' at this day

fields.description:
User report in here : https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4231

As you can see in screen shot below : 

!screenshot.PNG!

The description its only the field selected for the Card, but there is a plenty of space that can be used to show more of the description other then showing only 2 to 3 line from the description.

quote from the user comment : 
{quote}
Well. I want the card to be the same size.
I just don't want over half the card to be blank.

There is plenty of space on the card, for more of the description. 
So I want more of the description visible on the card.

Of course this is dependent on the configuration of the card.
In some cases there is only room for 2 lines (or even 1) of the descriptopn.
But the amount of lines the description takes, seems static to me. It should be dynamic.
{quote}
fields.summary: Resize Field Automatically Base On The Size Of The Field Value in All Cards

fields.description:
This is a complex one, so let's break it down.

* Providing a web panel on the View Issue page to display Scrum information.
* Information displayed will be a list of the sprints of which this issue is a part of.
* The sprints will be broken down into two sections: Active and Completed
* Sprints will provide a link to "go to the sprint". This means going to a Rapid Board for this sprint.
* The boards available to go to will be calculated only once the user initiates the action.
* Valid boards are calculated based on which boards the user has permission to see, as well as if the issue matches the filter of the board;
** Only scrum boards will be considered.
* If there are no valid boards, the user will be shown a message;
* If there are multiple valid boards, the user will be prompted to choose one.
* If there is only one valid board, or if the user has chosen a board, the user will be redirected instantly.
* The user will be redirected to the precise location of the sprint on the chosen board;
** If the sprint is active, the location is Work mode of the board.
** If the sprint is completed, the location is the retrospective report of that sprint on that board.
fields.summary: MVR: Agile issue web panel to display Scrum information of an issue

fields.description:
1. Enable Gravatar support in JIRA
2. Go to the RapidBoard
3. The avatars shown on card are not the Gravatar ones

To fix this use the AvatarService's {{getAvatarURL}} method instead of building your own avatar URL.
fields.summary: GreenHopper doesn't respect JIRA's avatar settings
Cycle time getting some very big values in certain conditions
As a confused user, I'd like a title attribute (tooltip) on the Plan mode disabled link with something helpful e.g. Plan mode is currently available only for Kanban boards.
Upgrade task to unify Board/Sprint data into AO instead of using PropertySets

fields.description:
Currently, the burndown chart is displayed in server time and displays the default user time zone (e.g. GMT + 10) below it.

We run distributed teams and they should be able to see it by default in their time zone and optionally in other time zones.

It is a very crucial thing that team members are able to view the burndown in their own time zone and to view it in their colleagues' time zone(s).

I suspect that this issue will need to be moved to the Greenhopper Project.
fields.summary: Allow Chart Board displays to be displayed in different time zones

fields.description:
By using the field configurations, JIRA allows the administrator to specify field descriptions that will show up when the user creates or edits a JIRA Issue. It would be helpful to have a way to display these in GreenHopper's "New Card" window

For example, I have a description on the "Summary" field to help people guide users when they create new user stories. These descriptions are helpful in JIRA, but they do not show up in GreenHopper (at least, not that I can tell).
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user, I would like to see field descriptions on the New Card display

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master I need to monitor the amount of time being logged within an iteration by my team so that I can ensure the the time logged matched my capacity.

I am told that the current "User Workload Report" only shows time logged for open issues. I cannot see why this would be valuable information to anyone. Surely it would make sense to group the time logged by user then iteration and/or release?
fields.summary: User Workload Report
Sprint marker jumps to bottom of the backlog if you delete an issue in a sprint

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

Looks to happen only for a few timezones where the timezone/DST db is out of date.

- Start JIRA with the timezone: Europe/Moscow
- Create a version and set its Start date to 02/03/2012 (you will see that it will actually change the saved date to 01/03/2012)
- Select the Chart Board and the follow stacktrace will be displayed.

I noticed that for Moscow the limit date is 25/26 of March that indicates that it is using the timezone database from 2007 that is the last year when the DST changed on this dates ([source|http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/timezone.html?n=166&syear=2000]).

fields.summary: Setting the Start Date of a version to a date where the DST is active will cause a NPE on the 'Hours Burndown Chart'

fields.description:
This story involves implementing Trevs MyHome page feature.

Currently this is a per user dark feature.

We could add a -button- affordance to make this available on the board page

Moves as you traverse with n and p 

Fixed on RHS with all columns visible)

Should the affordance just show the status of the parent
Minimum required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4857].
  {panel}

Cases:
* swimlanes without issue count: Duplicate swimlane headers can be seen (see screenshot)
* swimlanes with issue count: As above, plus issue count boxes jump up as the stalker kicks in
* no swimlanes, no issue count: Header becomes taller when the stalker kicks in.
* no swimlanes with issue count: Issue count boxes jump up as the stalker kicks in.

There are some hardcoded numbers in Stalker.js, these should probably be calculated based on the configuration and layout of the header.
fields.summary: GH stalker bar has some alignment issues
Analytics opt-in appearing on on-demand instances
Rapid board not showing CFD correctly when not all statuses are selected
Cycle time not shown on hover when only one status selected in the control graph

fields.description: I'd like to see what the various values of the control chart moving average is, especially what the value is on the end date of the graph (I'd like to see that value on a wallboard as well!) - on hover would be the most sensible suggestion on how you'd go about implementing it.
fields.summary: As a control chart user, I want to see actual values of the moving average on hover

fields.description:
A large number of users have no idea about the dot dialog, which IMO is one of the most useful keyboard shortcuts in JIRA.

It'd be great if we could call attention to it with in-menu pointers to those keyboard shortcuts.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like in-context pointers towards keyboard shortcuts for cog actions
On IE 9 the drag handle mouse icon stays as the cross even when you go into the details view on plan mode.

fields.description: I think its reasonable to have this information available to any board user.
fields.summary: As a user, i'd like to know what projects my board references
Ability to customize cards / card colors in Rapid View board
A quicker way of moving one or more tasks around the product backlog, other than simply selecting each one in turn and dragging it to the desired location, as it's time consuming and slow

fields.description: sprint retro and burndown reports handle nicely, work mode fails hard - the header gets rendered (including the complete sprint button), but the button doesn't work.
fields.summary: GreenHopper does not nicely handle the case where the last issue in a sprint is deleted.

fields.description: Message states "ranked to the top of the column", while really it ranked to the top of the (visible?) subtasks.
fields.summary: Send to top success message misleading for subtask

see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.9.3+Release+Notes

fields.description: Just for parent swimlane strategy

fields.description:
When opening the agile menu, the shortcuts for the planning and the task board are missing.

Steps to reproduce:

* Open Agile menu
* Hover over the menu entry for some seconds, until the title with the shortcut is displayed
* [BUG] no shortcut is displayed for the planning and the task board
fields.summary: Agile menu is missing shortcuts

fields.description: Let's add the ability to have a JIRA url with the additional parameter of theme so one can have a url including &theme="my theme" to return a list of the issues is the epic/theme tag.
fields.summary: Return list of issues in epic/theme from web service

fields.description: Customer wants a dashboard plugin for a pie chart to compare completed to pending story points for a defined user.
fields.summary: Customer request for Pie Chart showing Story Points pending/complete

fields.description:
According to the agile method, bugs take priority.  But in order to place them at the top of the Task Board, we need to create a Bugs story and make sure it's priority is at the top.

It would be nice if a preference would allow the "Other Issues" section to be placed higher than all stories.  Thus making bugs (or stories without sub-tasks - easily indicating needed work) higher priority.
fields.summary: Allow moving of "Other Issues" section to top of Task Board

fields.description: The JIRA Agile Global Rank field needs to have "Global Context", so it shouldn't be possible to change the context of this custom field to anything other than "Global Context".
fields.summary: It shouldn't be possible to set the context for the JIRA Agile Global Rank field
Detail view allows editing of closed issues, but update fails without displaying an error

fields.description: It moves some issues that it shouldn't. If you refresh the page, however, the order is back to normal / as expected.
fields.summary: Send to top, multiple issue ranking behaving strangely when the sprint marker is at the top
As a user I would like to rank above the marker even when there is one issue in scope
Update UI for swimlanes and columns

fields.description: Not including the Status icon as this may be 'gone' in JIRA soon anyway...
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the status of an issue in the detail view (in work and plan)

fields.description:
link to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Sorting+by+Rank+does+not+show+expected+values

ALSO, mention "Rank to Top" and "Rank to Bottom" (in "More Actions"; NB. also keyboard shortcuts when viewing on a board)
fields.summary: add "see also" to Ranking pages
TimeZone in the GreenHopper Charts should change according to the User profile settings.

fields.description:
Playing a naive first user, I'm creating a new rapid view using the Kanban presets and select one or a couple of projects. Now, my selection gives me tens of thousands of issues, since the projects are rather large. I only find that out once my browser died trying to display the rapid board.

It would be nice to be warned on the standard preset dialog if the query I'm creating returns too many issues.
fields.summary: As a first user, I'd like to be warned about too many issues when creating a rapid view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4780].
  {panel}

"Release" function in Rapid Boards not working as expected:
It appears there's a problem in applying the sub-filter defined for "Work" view, resulting in issues that no longer appear in the RB getting attached to new version, as long as they share the same status as defined for the "Done" column.
To reproduce:
1. Create new issue.
2. Drag to Done column (mapped to "Resolved" status)
3. hit the Release button --> enter details of new version and click Close.
4. note release form closes, Done column clears.
5. Hit Release button again.
Expected result: notification should show there's nothing to release.
Actual result: Release form loads up, selecting same issue that has been released in previous steps. Creating new version will create new version and attach issue created above to this new version, in addition to previous.
Note problem does not appear once released issues are moved to Closed status.
fields.summary: Release button in work mode does not respect work mode sub filter for Kanban

fields.description: We have several columns on our rapid board and while the Story (parent) ticket types wrap, the subtasks do not, making it impossible to tell what they are. I recommend either make wrapping the default or a configuration setting. Also, I would prefer to see the entire Story ticket summary as well, and it looks like that gets unnecessarily truncated.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I need the subtask summaries to wrap so I can see what the subtask is
Rank up / down buttons should have a permission condition

fields.description:
Needs drop down in the config (refer to design)
Parents always present except if themselves and all of their children are filtered 
Swimlane configuration retains user defined filters even if you switch to parent strategy
fields.summary: MVR: Implement visualisation of swimlanes as parents

Client side as a first attempt
Straight direct match of substring is minimum (no need for multiple keywords)

fields.description: Please see ticket https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3893 for details
fields.summary: Allow custom sorting in custom contexts

fields.description:
- Should handle change of Story Points value


https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Estimation+and+Tracking+in+the+Rapid+Board#EstimationandTrackingintheRapidBoard-Tracking
- The graph begins at the start time of the Sprint, it logically ends on the specified end date of the Sprint (which is marked on the graph) but continues until the time the Sprint was actually closed
- Allow the Sprint to be specified but default to currently active Sprint 
- The start value of the graph does not compensate for changes after the start of the sprint to the value 
- Items burn down as they reach the done column 
- Items that are added to the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change 
- Items that are removed from the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change 
- Items that have their estimate changed after the beginning of the Sprint are shown as scope change 
- Scope changes (i.e anything other than a burndown) are shown with some sort of visual signal and information on hovering the inflection point
fields.summary: MVR: Make the burndown chart understand when an issue was added/removed from Sprint (i.e understand scope change)

fields.description:
- Smaller one than in the general one
- Hovers if possible
fields.summary: MVR: Sprint Report to include a burndown for the Sprint itself
MVR: Report page showing Sprints (with a selector), include table of issues, link to issue nav

fields.description:
This is a complex one, so let's break it down.

* Providing an issue operation for an Issue to be able to "go to" a Rapid Board for this issue.
* The boards available to go to will be calculated only once the user initiates the action.
* Valid boards are calculated based on which boards the user has permission to see, as well as if the issue matches the filter of the board;
** In the case of Kanban boards, the issue must also match the Work mode sub filter. It should *not* match if the issue only appears on Report mode.
** In the case of Scrum boards, the issue may appear in any mode (Plan, Work or Report).
* If there are no valid boards, the user will be shown a message;
** _Optionally, the user will be prompted to create a new board based on the project of the issue_.
* If there are multiple valid boards, the user will be prompted to choose one.
* If there is only one valid board, or if the user has chosen a board, the user will be redirected instantly.
* The user will be redirected to the precise location of the issue on the chosen board.
** The issue will be selected if the location is Plan or Work mode.
** In the case of a Scrum board, if the location is the Report mode, and the issue belongs to more than one sprint, the most recent sprint's retrospective report will be chosen.
fields.summary: MVR: Issue operation to jump to a rapid board from an Issue

fields.description:

* turn on quick filter to hide 400 worth
* correctly shows 500 still
* however start dragging the marker and it resets back to the visible count
* turn quick filter off
* does NOT update marker

The marker does not updated when you edit the story points
